Reviews.Title: This is an excellent outdoor IP camera at a competitive price ...
Reviews.Author: D. Fowler

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moAQMPQPTT5QJUcurrentClick) { return cv_moAQMPQPTT5QJUcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:37 MinsNo doubt that if you haven't set up a security camera before you'll be needing some assistance. I usually have someone come in to help me with setup because, least ways in my case, something is difficult to manage. For example, the factory set IP may not be compatible with your local network. In this case you'll be needing some assistance, but this issue can be worked through.At this point in time, GigaEye is new to the market and their website is still under construction, including the user manual that the security camera neophyte would need to access. Anyone else who has set this type of camera up before may well be familiar with this type of issue and won't have problems. Others who are inexperienced may wish to take a pass ... for now.Competitively, this camera has a price point considerably lower than most on the market. The quick start guide is quite clear and gives instructions as to Wi-Fi connection setup, remote access setup, references concerning port forwarding, getting a WLAN IP address, hardware installation, and wired access for first time use. The camera works as it claims, but due to the lack of support at this time, I need to subtract a star from my rating.WHAT'S IN THE BOX:► GigaEye Gb170 Outdoor IP Camera► Software CD► Power Adapter► Plastic Stand► Ethernet Cable► Mounting Bracket & ScrewsFEATURES:☼ Waterproof☼ Motion Detection with Email/FTP Alarm☼ Remote Access☼ Night Vision☼ IR Cut Filter☼ WiFi Connection☼ iPhone/Android CompatibleSPECS:► Model: GigaEye GB170► Image Sensor: CMOS Sensor► Display Resolution: 640*480► Lens: 4mm (IR Lens)► Viewing Angle: 60°► Image Compression: MJPEG► Audio: Not Supported► Pan/Tilt Angle: None► Infrared Lights: 36 IR LEDS, Night Vision up to 25 meters► Storage Temperature: -10°C ~ 60° (14°F ~ 140°)► Storage Humidity: 0° ~ 90% non-condensing► Supported OS: Microsoft Windows 2000/XP, Vista, Windows 7, Mac OS, Linux► Browser: IE6/IE7/IE8/IE9/Firefox/Safari/Chrome and other standard browsers► Certifications: CE, FCC► Warranty: 2 year, limitedSample provided for review.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions
Reviews.Author: nosebreaker
Reviews.Content: I just installed this, and being familiar with IP cameras I had no problems getting it to work.  I hardwired the ethernet as well as power, I did not want to risk interference with wireless.The software seems to be from the GB150, I would surmise they took a 150 and put it in a weatherproof case.  The motion detection email alarm worked perfectly, it sends a few pictures attached to the email when it detects motion.  The night vision is pretty good also, you can see a little bit of red in the LEDs at night.The downside is that the field of vision is very narrow.  I bought this thinking I could cover my driveway, but even at 25ft away it barely covers more than my door and half a parking spot.  I'll be getting a different camera that can cover the entire area.  But otherwise the camera is fine, so 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Very solid camera, great performance.
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: I have tried many cameras, wansview, edimax, foscam, etc. So far this is the best camera I've used. For the price I paid for this camera, it's totally a steal.The build of this camera is very solid. I've seen so many cheap cameras, most of them are like plastic toys. This camera is totally different, it weights quite heavy, the metal is quite thick and make me feel confident about having this outdoor.Installation is easy, three screws and you are done (sadly you still need to wire power cord for an outdoor camera). The setup is easy too, software is quite intuitive and takes less than 5 minutes. I can use my phone or PC to watch live feed of the camera from anywhere. The image quality is way better than other cameras. Even though the resolutions are the same, somehow this camera's image is sharper as I compare it side to side to another brand.The camera is reliable, no question at all. I set up the camera to upload image every minute, any missing image will trigger an alarm. The camera has been running none stop for over a week and not a single upload missed.Last but not least, the price is not beatable by any other camera. Give this camera a try, you will like it too!

Reviews.Title: Not Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Terrible WiFi range and the FPS is under 20. I would not recommend this to anyone, pay the extra $50 and get a working model.

Reviews.Title: Never worked
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "smorloc"
Reviews.Content: I was never able to connect this camera to my network.  The application to scan for a camera never found one.  My router showed that it never requested a DHCP address.  There were no signs of life other than a single LED on the network connector.  The manufacturer's web site was useless.  All the links for support, FAQs, downloads, troubleshooting are all are dummies.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for an affordable price.
Reviews.Author: B. Boal
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great deal. The price is much lower than other cameras of comparable quality and the functions make it a very effective and versatile home security measure. I would recommend this camera to any person who wants added security at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for an easy-to-mount, hi-tech IP Camera
Reviews.Author: MarisaH
Reviews.Content: Because my mother is leaving alone in a not-so-safe area, I decided to install a surveillance camera outside of her house for some obvious extra-security reasons.After doing a lot of research on the internet I have come to the conclusion that Gigaeye GB170 should be the best choice because of its excellent ratio between quality and price. Also, I have been attracted by the fact that its description suggests that this camera can be easily mounted anywhere.And so it was! Even if I am a woman with no tech-oriented skills, I have managed to install it easily, connect it to the WIFI network in my mom’s house and also access it from thousands of miles away, where I currently live.The materials from which it is built are top notch. But its features are the ones that will amaze anybody: you have 36 infrared LEDs which seriously improve the image quality in difficult conditions. Then, you are provided with the capability to place it anywhere you want, as long as your WIFI router is covering the area with sufficient signal. And this is when the fun part begins: grab your smartphone fire up the iSmartView application and watch what’s happening outside of your mom’s house.You cannot wish more from a surveillance camera with such a good price.

Reviews.Title: Easy operation and great convenience
Reviews.Author: Wilson R "w.c.r"
Reviews.Content: I took a little while to access on the WiFi and port forwarded on my router to get it viewed on the browser. Now we can fix it anywhere since it no longer needs to be plugged in the router by cable. I can also adjust the video recording, motion detect Email alert. More to my satisfaction, I can use it for some specific security needs, such as baby monitoring, garage monitoring for it works normally even in total pitch blackness.

Reviews.Title: OK but not waterproof as advertised.
Reviews.Author: william hill
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great image and was easy to setup, but it appears that it is not weatherproof as advertised. The lenses appears to fog up when it rains.

Reviews.Title: Never Could Get it to Work, CS is Terrible
Reviews.Author: JLDLF
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the features it offered, including wireless connectivity to my home network, outdoor capabilities and night-time recording. I could never get it to connect to my home network. The instructions, which are terrible and sparse, noted this problem was a possibility and instructed to contact customer service. However, when I tried to call, they simply put you into voice mail and the company answering is under a different name than Gigaeye. I tried getting on their website and few of the links work and none of the links in "Support" work. I also tried to e-mail them and the e-mail was returned as undeliverable because "recipient does not exist". This company definitely strikes me as being quite shady and I would NOT recommend them.

ProductInfo.Features:
IR Cut Filter - Help to produce accurate color images by blocking the transmission of the infrared light while passing the visible light.
Motion Detection with Email/FTP Alarm - When any behavior is detected, the alarm system will be triggered and then send you the notification email with screenshots attachment, and upload video clips & images to your FTP server.
Wifi Connection - Support 802.1b/g/n Wifi connection protocol, which has full compatibility with your router. The camera could be moved wherever your Wifi signal is accessible. Ethernet cable is not a necessity.
Remote Access - You can access the camera from remote location by Internet. The free DDNS service is provided permanently. You can also use your private DDNS service.
Two-way Audio - Support interactive communication between the camera and monitoring site. An external speaker is needed if you want to talk with the people under surveillance; Night Vision - 10 infrared LEDs deliver up to 8m (26ft) of night vision for effective 24/7 performance.
ProductInfo.Name: Gigaeye® GB170 Waterproof Outdoor Wireless Wifi Bullet IP Camera with IR-Cut Filter, Motion Detection with Email/FTP Alarm, 36 Infrared LEDs for up to 25M Night Vision (GB170)
